item.title: Automated Mining Interface - Hector Mejia
item.description:
Automated Mining Interface - Hector Mejia

This project is part of the course "Professional use" of the Master In Interaction Design (IxD) program in Umeå Institute of Design at Umeå University. Is a group project with fellows IxDs Shigeo Katsura-Gordon, Yi-Ting Chien and Siddharth Hirwani. Nowadays a stationary rock-breaker is used to break the large material into smaller pieces in mining operations.

item.title: Min Kompis - Hector Mejia
item.description:
Min Kompis - Hector Mejia

This project was part of the GE Makeathon challenge on Early health and the physical environment hosted by GE and FabLab in Sliperiet in Umeå (Sweden). Working with fellow Interaction Design students Lene Rydningen and Akansha Aggarwal the project was the winner of the challenge.

item.title: Ploppi's Bakery - Hector Mejia
item.description:
Ploppi's Bakery - Hector Mejia

Ploppi's Bakery is a kit that consist of a semi-interactive plushie monster (Ploppi) that the child can feed cookies as a reward for completing speech tasks in an application controlled by a parent and modified by the speech therapist. Is an extension tool that allows the child to continue his speech therapy at home.
